comment: had her for strengths lab, and she has a thick accent. One other problem is she takes the lab SO seriously. machine wouldnt make the member fail, so we sat for 3 hours until time for class was up. yes we had to sit there and watch a piece of steel rotate for 3 hours. She needs to understand it is a 1 hour credit course.

she is tough  didn't prepare us for final exam and tests were challenging home work was easy  If statics is one of those subject that required for your enginnering degree then take someone else but if you are going to use statics in courses going forward then take this prof. she will prepare you
She is perfect, gives three tests, quiz every week,     And homework about each chapter. She is always available during her office hour. I recommended her.

I like this professor. Very helpful, always available after class for help. goes fast sometimes but she does not mind to go over the material again. If you do the HW you will easily pass the class. Take her If you can

She took almost the whole semester to cover the first 3 chapters, and finished by covering almost a chapter a day because we were so far behind before the final.  On the plus side, she grades generously.  If you do the recommended problems they are almost identical to the tests.

Professor Alateek is difficult to understand at times. When asked questions she seems annoyed. The rate at which she covers course topics is variable and may lead to stress when she throws dozens of new concepts at you right before a test. My advice, choose someone else. You will learn more and have less stress.

Nice teacher but fundamentals not covered very well. Alot of material in course so her speed in covering material doesn't help. Moody when answering questions and deters students from asking. Adjunct so limited hours for seeking assistance outside of the class.

I have heard statics is a weed out class, but really it is a class of desire. If you only do the homework, there is a good chance you will not pass. Work lots of extra problems from the book and there is a good chance you will have seen the problem when the test comes around. Read the book. Do extra problems and an easy A is possible. She is nice.

Pretty bad at explaining the subject matter. Inconsistent, Present 1 out of the 4 times on test days. Doesn't return the homework back on time. She is not very convincing that she knows the subject matter at all.
Excellent professor. Clear, fair, helpful, knows her stuff. Really cares about the students progress. One of the best.!
Not bad but can be somewhat boring. She is harsh grader.

She's okay when it comes to grading. Use the textbook to learn, not her lecture. It is often confusing and inconsistent. Not sure if she knows what she's doing most of the time. During one class, half the students got up and left when she answered a question with an obviously incorrect answer. She still tried to argue it. Nod your head and move on.
This professor is awesome, she is very helpful,very kind. Give us alot of examples and ideas.i recommend her for every body.
Professor Alateek was perhaps one of the worst professors I had in a while. Although her tests are relatively easy and she grades easy, her teaching is often messy and overly complex.
